cross_training_opportunities: Pair programming sessions between backend developers on specialized topics (Jint vs. Plugins).
contractor_augmentation_option: Not required for core skills, but could help with overload.
cost_optimization: Team is skilled but overloaded. Rebalancing work is the first step before hiring.
future_scaling: Can handle 10-15% more work if rebalanced, but significant new features require more staff.

cross_training_opportunities: Train a backend developer in basic React/MUI for simple UI tasks and bug fixes.
contractor_augmentation_option: Highly recommended. A contract React developer for 8 weeks would de-risk the timeline.
cost_optimization: Hiring a contractor is costly but cheaper than project delays.
future_scaling: No scaling capacity. This is a major bottleneck.

cross_training_opportunities: Lead Architect to mentor backend devs on secure coding practices for sandboxing and encryption.
contractor_augmentation_option: A part-time security consultant for reviews could offload the Lead Architect.
cost_optimization: The Lead Architect is a bottleneck. Distributing review responsibilities is key.
future_scaling: Cannot scale without more senior/lead level engineers.
